p.style: margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px;

p.span: In the program, all objects interact by means of two forces (In the case of Elastic collisions, three).

p.style: -qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-size:10pt; color:#000000;

p.span: All objects with mass are affected by the force of gravity. The force of gravity acting between the two objects is calculated by the following formula:

p.span: All objects that have a charge, the force of the pendant. It is important to note that in the classical formulation of Coulomb's law, the formula holds for the modulus of force, not for the finite force. The classical formulation:
